intro: Townsendia fremontii, commonly known as the Fremont's gayfeather, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as grasslands and slopes. It produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Townsendia fremontii is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to dry environments.
